LINES.text: Buenos Aires, December 29, 2020.

For 30 years, women in Argentina
have been fighting to legalize abortion.

Before 2020, abortions were legal only
in a few small countries in the region,

Argentina is the first large
country to take the lead.

In February 2022,
Colombia legalized abortion

during the first 24
weeks of pregnancy.

abortions were only allowed in very
few cases, like rape. In Tucuman in 2019,

an 11-year-old girl became
pregnant after being raped...

Never in my 21-year-long career had it
happened to me that someone refused

The government elected in
2019 set out to change that.

On the 30th of December, the law on
safe and free legal abortion was passed.

and free of charge
up to the 14th week.

Abortion was criminalised in the
Argentinian Penal Code in 1921.

In more than 90
per cent of cases,

On average, 10 women are
killed every day in Mexico.

A suburb of Mexico City, a
metropolis of several million.

It’s been three years and five
months. She left for work one day.

Two men confessed
to Norma’s murder,

Mama, we are the three
musketeers, one for all and all for one.

This is my twentieth time here
in three years and five months.

After three years and five months
? I'm not an expert, I’m not a lawyer.

Out of every 100 acts of violence,
about 98.5 per cent go unpunished.

22-year-old Lesvy was
murdered by her partner.

But eventually, her murderer was
sentenced to 45 years in prison.

There are now four times as many
investigators working on femicides

That’s just one
case — all of it.

At least three out of five
women I accompany every day

Anne also became pregnant
at 16 after being raped.

but no one prepared
her for what was to come.

I had told one of my friends
what I was going through,

She stayed with me for three
days, she gave me a sense of calm.
Ni una mas ? not one more.

One of the richest
pastors in Brazil,

he’s a celebrity with nearly 9 million
followers on various social networks
He combines two things.

In 2020, about 3,900
women were killed in Brazil.

six months have passed
since abortion was legalized.

These two have gone to court
with women seeking abortions.

In my hospital, a maternity
clinic, out of 30 doctors,

27 are conscientious objectors and
refuse to apply the law. Only 3 are not.
